dict.string: 1. Enable the tweak for new purchases and/or updates 2. Enter a reasonable iOS version to spoof (e.g. the latest public release) 3. Confirm your changes by tapping the "Apply" button 4. Purchase the app (the installation may fail or the app will not open) 5. Delete the app if it was installed 6. Disable the tweak 7. Re-download the app to obtain the latest compatible version for the iOS version of the device if it exists Disclaimer: Enabling the update option could result in your device displaying updates for apps which might fail to install depending on the spoofed iOS version that was entered. When using this option, it is suggested to use a higher minor version of iOS than what is currently installed (e.g. spoofing to iOS 16.7.10 for a device running iOS 16.5) since apps with higher minor version requirements may still install and run properly.
